p: The essential oil of the X6M15 genotype disclosed 1,8-cineole and myrcene as its major constituents (29.40 and 14.70%, respectively, Figure 1). The existence of a 1,8-cineole:myrcene chemotype was reported by Ricciardi, 2009 [ 31], in which the amounts of these compounds reached only 14.70% and 10.40%, respectively.1,8-cineole is a saturated monoterpene with pleasant aroma and taste, widely used in food, fragrances, and cosmetics [ 64]. Plenty studies have reported the substances as having benefits for respiratory tract infection, such as bronchitis, sinusitis as well as exhibiting secretolytic and bronchospasmolytic properties, and anti-inflammatory, antimicrobial, and antiseptic efficacy [ 64].
